045package org.jfree.chart.axis;
046
047import java.awt.Font;
048import java.awt.FontMetrics;
049import java.awt.Graphics2D;
050import java.awt.font.FontRenderContext;
051import java.awt.font.LineMetrics;
052import java.awt.geom.Rectangle2D;
053import java.io.Serializable;

078/**
079 * The base class for axes that display dates.  You will find it easier to
080 * understand how this axis works if you bear in mind that it really
081 * displays/measures integer (or long) data, where the integers are
082 * milliseconds since midnight, 1-Jan-1970.  When displaying tick labels, the
083 * millisecond values are converted back to dates using a {@code DateFormat} 
084 * instance.
085 * <P>
086 * You can also create a {@link org.jfree.chart.axis.Timeline} and supply in
087 * the constructor to create an axis that only contains certain domain values.
088 * For example, this allows you to create a date axis that only contains
089 * working days.
090 */
091public class DateAxis extends ValueAxis implements Cloneable, Serializable {
092
093    /** For serialization. */
094    private static final long serialVersionUID = -1013460999649007604L;
095
096    /** The default axis range. */
097    public static final DateRange DEFAULT_DATE_RANGE = new DateRange();
098
099    /** The default minimum auto range size. */
100    public static final double
101            DEFAULT_AUTO_RANGE_MINIMUM_SIZE_IN_MILLISECONDS = 2.0;
102
103    /** The default anchor date. */
104    public static final Date DEFAULT_ANCHOR_DATE = new Date();
105
106    /** The current tick unit. */
107    private DateTickUnit tickUnit;
108
109    /** The override date format. */
110    private DateFormat dateFormatOverride;
111
112    /**
113     * Tick marks can be displayed at the start or the middle of the time
114     * period.
115     */
116    private DateTickMarkPosition tickMarkPosition = DateTickMarkPosition.START;
117
118    /**
119     * A timeline that includes all milliseconds (as defined by
120     * {@code java.util.Date}) in the real time line.
121     */
122    private static class DefaultTimeline implements Timeline, Serializable {
123
124        /**
125         * Converts a millisecond into a timeline value.
126         *
127         * @param millisecond  the millisecond.
128         *
129         * @return The timeline value.
130         */
131        @Override
132        public long toTimelineValue(long millisecond) {
133            return millisecond;
134        }
135
136        /**
137         * Converts a date into a timeline value.
138         *
139         * @param date  the domain value.
140         *
141         * @return The timeline value.
142         */
143        @Override
144        public long toTimelineValue(Date date) {
145            return date.getTime();
146        }
147
148        /**
149         * Converts a timeline value into a millisecond (as encoded by
150         * {@code java.util.Date}).
151         *
152         * @param value  the value.
153         *
154         * @return The millisecond.
155         */
156        @Override
157        public long toMillisecond(long value) {
158            return value;
159        }
160
161        /**
162         * Returns {@code true} if the timeline includes the specified
163         * domain value.
164         *
165         * @param millisecond  the millisecond.
166         *
167         * @return {@code true}.
168         */
169        @Override
170        public boolean containsDomainValue(long millisecond) {
171            return true;
172        }
173
174        /**
175         * Returns {@code true} if the timeline includes the specified
176         * domain value.
177         *
178         * @param date  the date.
179         *
180         * @return {@code true}.
181         */
182        @Override
183        public boolean containsDomainValue(Date date) {
184            return true;
185        }
186
187        /**
188         * Returns {@code true} if the timeline includes the specified
189         * domain value range.
190         *
191         * @param from  the start value.
192         * @param to  the end value.
193         *
194         * @return {@code true}.
195         */
196        @Override
197        public boolean containsDomainRange(long from, long to) {
198            return true;
199        }
200
201        /**
202         * Returns {@code true} if the timeline includes the specified
203         * domain value range.
204         *
205         * @param from  the start date.
206         * @param to  the end date.
207         *
208         * @return {@code true}.
209         */
210        @Override
211        public boolean containsDomainRange(Date from, Date to) {
212            return true;
213        }
214
215        /**
216         * Tests an object for equality with this instance.
217         *
218         * @param object  the object.
219         *
220         * @return A boolean.
221         */
222        @Override
223        public boolean equals(Object object) {
224            if (object == null) {
225                return false;
226            }
227            if (object == this) {
228                return true;
229            }
230            if (object instanceof DefaultTimeline) {
231                return true;
232            }
233            return false;
234        }
235    }
236
237    /** A static default timeline shared by all standard DateAxis */
238    private static final Timeline DEFAULT_TIMELINE = new DefaultTimeline();
239
240    /** The time zone for the axis. */
241    private TimeZone timeZone;
242
243    /**
244     * The locale for the axis ({@code null} is not permitted).
245     */
246    private Locale locale;
247
248    /** Our underlying timeline. */
249    private Timeline timeline;
250
251    /**
252     * Creates a date axis with no label.
253     */
254    public DateAxis() {
255        this(null);
256    }
257
258    /**
259     * Creates a date axis with the specified label.
260     *
261     * @param label  the axis label ({@code null} permitted).
262     */
263    public DateAxis(String label) {
264        this(label, TimeZone.getDefault(), Locale.getDefault());
265    }
266
267    /**
268     * Creates a date axis.
269     *
270     * @param label  the axis label ({@code null} permitted).
271     * @param zone  the time zone.
272     * @param locale  the locale ({@code null} not permitted).
273     */
274    public DateAxis(String label, TimeZone zone, Locale locale) {
275        super(label, DateAxis.createStandardDateTickUnits(zone, locale));
276        this.tickUnit = new DateTickUnit(DateTickUnitType.DAY, 1, 
277                new SimpleDateFormat());
278        setAutoRangeMinimumSize(
279                DEFAULT_AUTO_RANGE_MINIMUM_SIZE_IN_MILLISECONDS);
280        setRange(DEFAULT_DATE_RANGE, false, false);
281        this.dateFormatOverride = null;
282        this.timeZone = zone;
283        this.locale = locale;
284        this.timeline = DEFAULT_TIMELINE;
285    }
286
287    /**
288     * Returns the time zone for the axis.
289     *
290     * @return The time zone (never {@code null}).
291     *
292     * @see #setTimeZone(TimeZone)
293     */
294    public TimeZone getTimeZone() {
295        return this.timeZone;
296    }
297
298    /**
299     * Sets the time zone for the axis and sends an {@link AxisChangeEvent} to
300     * all registered listeners.
301     *
302     * @param zone  the time zone ({@code null} not permitted).
303     *
304     * @see #getTimeZone()
305     */
306    public void setTimeZone(TimeZone zone) {
307        Args.nullNotPermitted(zone, "zone");
308        this.timeZone = zone;
309        setStandardTickUnits(createStandardDateTickUnits(zone, this.locale));
310        fireChangeEvent();
311    }
312    
313    /**
314     * Returns the locale for this axis.
315     * 
316     * @return The locale (never {@code null}).
317     */
318    public Locale getLocale() {
319        return this.locale;
320    }
321    
322    /**
323     * Sets the locale for the axis and sends a change event to all registered 
324     * listeners.
325     * 
326     * @param locale  the new locale ({@code null} not permitted).
327     */
328    public void setLocale(Locale locale) {
329        Args.nullNotPermitted(locale, "locale");
330        this.locale = locale;
331        setStandardTickUnits(createStandardDateTickUnits(this.timeZone, 
332                this.locale));
333        fireChangeEvent();
334    }
335
336    /**
337     * Returns the underlying timeline used by this axis.
338     *
339     * @return The timeline.
340     */
341    public Timeline getTimeline() {
342        return this.timeline;
343    }
344
345    /**
346     * Sets the underlying timeline to use for this axis.  If the timeline is 
347     * changed, an {@link AxisChangeEvent} is sent to all registered listeners.
348     *
349     * @param timeline  the timeline.
350     */
351    public void setTimeline(Timeline timeline) {
352        if (this.timeline != timeline) {
353            this.timeline = timeline;
354            fireChangeEvent();
355        }
356    }
357
358    /**
359     * Returns the tick unit for the axis.
360     * <p>
361     * Note: if the {@code autoTickUnitSelection} flag is
362     * {@code true} the tick unit may be changed while the axis is being
363     * drawn, so in that case the return value from this method may be
364     * irrelevant if the method is called before the axis has been drawn.
365     *
366     * @return The tick unit (possibly {@code null}).
367     *
368     * @see #setTickUnit(DateTickUnit)
369     * @see ValueAxis#isAutoTickUnitSelection()
370     */
371    public DateTickUnit getTickUnit() {
372        return this.tickUnit;
373    }
374
375    /**
376     * Sets the tick unit for the axis.  The auto-tick-unit-selection flag is
377     * set to {@code false}, and registered listeners are notified that
378     * the axis has been changed.
379     *
380     * @param unit  the tick unit.
381     *
382     * @see #getTickUnit()
383     * @see #setTickUnit(DateTickUnit, boolean, boolean)
384     */
385    public void setTickUnit(DateTickUnit unit) {
386        setTickUnit(unit, true, true);
387    }
388
389    /**
390     * Sets the tick unit attribute and, if requested, sends an 
391     * {@link AxisChangeEvent} to all registered listeners.
392     *
393     * @param unit  the new tick unit.
394     * @param notify  notify registered listeners?
395     * @param turnOffAutoSelection  turn off auto selection?
396     *
397     * @see #getTickUnit()
398     */
399    public void setTickUnit(DateTickUnit unit, boolean notify,
400                            boolean turnOffAutoSelection) {
401
402        this.tickUnit = unit;
403        if (turnOffAutoSelection) {
404            setAutoTickUnitSelection(false, false);
405        }
406        if (notify) {
407            fireChangeEvent();
408        }
409
410    }
411
412    /**
413     * Returns the date format override.  If this is non-null, then it will be
414     * used to format the dates on the axis.
415     *
416     * @return The formatter (possibly {@code null}).
417     */
418    public DateFormat getDateFormatOverride() {
419        return this.dateFormatOverride;
420    }
421
422    /**
423     * Sets the date format override and sends an {@link AxisChangeEvent} to 
424     * all registered listeners.  If this is non-null, then it will be
425     * used to format the dates on the axis.
426     *
427     * @param formatter  the date formatter ({@code null} permitted).
428     */
429    public void setDateFormatOverride(DateFormat formatter) {
430        this.dateFormatOverride = formatter;
431        fireChangeEvent();
432    }
433
434    /**
435     * Sets the upper and lower bounds for the axis and sends an
436     * {@link AxisChangeEvent} to all registered listeners.  As a side-effect,
437     * the auto-range flag is set to false.
438     *
439     * @param range  the new range ({@code null} not permitted).
440     */
441    @Override
442    public void setRange(Range range) {
443        setRange(range, true, true);
444    }
445
446    /**
447     * Sets the range for the axis, if requested, sends an
448     * {@link AxisChangeEvent} to all registered listeners.  As a side-effect,
449     * the auto-range flag is set to {@code false} (optional).
450     *
451     * @param range  the range ({@code null} not permitted).
452     * @param turnOffAutoRange  a flag that controls whether or not the auto
453     *                          range is turned off.
454     * @param notify  a flag that controls whether or not listeners are
455     *                notified.
456     */
457    @Override
458    public void setRange(Range range, boolean turnOffAutoRange,
459                         boolean notify) {
460        Args.nullNotPermitted(range, "range");
461        // usually the range will be a DateRange, but if it isn't do a
462        // conversion...
463        if (!(range instanceof DateRange)) {
464            range = new DateRange(range);
465        }
466        super.setRange(range, turnOffAutoRange, notify);
467    }
468
469    /**
470     * Sets the axis range and sends an {@link AxisChangeEvent} to all
471     * registered listeners.
472     *
473     * @param lower  the lower bound for the axis.
474     * @param upper  the upper bound for the axis.
475     */
476    public void setRange(Date lower, Date upper) {
477        if (lower.getTime() >= upper.getTime()) {
478            throw new IllegalArgumentException("Requires 'lower' < 'upper'.");
479        }
480        setRange(new DateRange(lower, upper));
481    }
482
483    /**
484     * Sets the axis range and sends an {@link AxisChangeEvent} to all
485     * registered listeners.
486     *
487     * @param lower  the lower bound for the axis.
488     * @param upper  the upper bound for the axis.
489     */
490    @Override
491    public void setRange(double lower, double upper) {
492        if (lower >= upper) {
493            throw new IllegalArgumentException("Requires 'lower' < 'upper'.");
494        }
495        setRange(new DateRange(lower, upper));
496    }
497
498    /**
499     * Returns the earliest date visible on the axis.
500     *
501     * @return The date.
502     *
503     * @see #setMinimumDate(Date)
504     * @see #getMaximumDate()
505     */
506    public Date getMinimumDate() {
507        Date result;
508        Range range = getRange();
509        if (range instanceof DateRange) {
510            DateRange r = (DateRange) range;
511            result = r.getLowerDate();
512        }
513        else {
514            result = new Date((long) range.getLowerBound());
515        }
516        return result;
517    }
518
519    /**
520     * Sets the minimum date visible on the axis and sends an
521     * {@link AxisChangeEvent} to all registered listeners.  If
522     * {@code date} is on or after the current maximum date for
523     * the axis, the maximum date will be shifted to preserve the current
524     * length of the axis.
525     *
526     * @param date  the date ({@code null} not permitted).
527     *
528     * @see #getMinimumDate()
529     * @see #setMaximumDate(Date)
530     */
531    public void setMinimumDate(Date date) {
532        Args.nullNotPermitted(date, "date");
533        // check the new minimum date relative to the current maximum date
534        Date maxDate = getMaximumDate();
535        long maxMillis = maxDate.getTime();
536        long newMinMillis = date.getTime();
537        if (maxMillis <= newMinMillis) {
538            Date oldMin = getMinimumDate();
539            long length = maxMillis - oldMin.getTime();
540            maxDate = new Date(newMinMillis + length);
541        }
542        setRange(new DateRange(date, maxDate), true, false);
543        fireChangeEvent();
544    }
545
546    /**
547     * Returns the latest date visible on the axis.
548     *
549     * @return The date.
550     *
551     * @see #setMaximumDate(Date)
552     * @see #getMinimumDate()
553     */
554    public Date getMaximumDate() {
555        Date result;
556        Range range = getRange();
557        if (range instanceof DateRange) {
558            DateRange r = (DateRange) range;
559            result = r.getUpperDate();
560        }
561        else {
562            result = new Date((long) range.getUpperBound());
563        }
564        return result;
565    }
566
567    /**
568     * Sets the maximum date visible on the axis and sends an
569     * {@link AxisChangeEvent} to all registered listeners.  If
570     * {@code maximumDate} is on or before the current minimum date for
571     * the axis, the minimum date will be shifted to preserve the current
572     * length of the axis.
573     *
574     * @param maximumDate  the date ({@code null} not permitted).
575     *
576     * @see #getMinimumDate()
577     * @see #setMinimumDate(Date)
578     */
579    public void setMaximumDate(Date maximumDate) {
580        Args.nullNotPermitted(maximumDate, "maximumDate");
581        // check the new maximum date relative to the current minimum date
582        Date minDate = getMinimumDate();
583        long minMillis = minDate.getTime();
584        long newMaxMillis = maximumDate.getTime();
585        if (minMillis >= newMaxMillis) {
586            Date oldMax = getMaximumDate();
587            long length = oldMax.getTime() - minMillis;
588            minDate = new Date(newMaxMillis - length);
589        }
590        setRange(new DateRange(minDate, maximumDate), true, false);
591        fireChangeEvent();
592    }
593
594    /**
595     * Returns the tick mark position (start, middle or end of the time period).
596     *
597     * @return The position (never {@code null}).
598     */
599    public DateTickMarkPosition getTickMarkPosition() {
600        return this.tickMarkPosition;
601    }
602
603    /**
604     * Sets the tick mark position (start, middle or end of the time period)
605     * and sends an {@link AxisChangeEvent} to all registered listeners.
606     *
607     * @param position  the position ({@code null} not permitted).
608     */
609    public void setTickMarkPosition(DateTickMarkPosition position) {
610        Args.nullNotPermitted(position, "position");
611        this.tickMarkPosition = position;
612        fireChangeEvent();
613    }
614
615    /**
616     * Configures the axis to work with the specified plot.  If the axis has
617     * auto-scaling, then sets the maximum and minimum values.
618     */
619    @Override
620    public void configure() {
621        if (isAutoRange()) {
622            autoAdjustRange();
623        }
624    }
625
626    /**
627     * Returns {@code true} if the axis hides this value, and
628     * {@code false} otherwise.
629     *
630     * @param millis  the data value.
631     *
632     * @return A value.
633     */
634    public boolean isHiddenValue(long millis) {
635        return (!this.timeline.containsDomainValue(new Date(millis)));
636    }
637
638    /**
639     * Translates the data value to the display coordinates (Java 2D User Space)
640     * of the chart.
641     *
642     * @param value  the date to be plotted.
643     * @param area  the rectangle (in Java2D space) where the data is to be
644     *              plotted.
645     * @param edge  the axis location.
646     *
647     * @return The coordinate corresponding to the supplied data value.
648     */
649    @Override
650    public double valueToJava2D(double value, Rectangle2D area,
651            RectangleEdge edge) {
652
653        value = this.timeline.toTimelineValue((long) value);
654
655        DateRange range = (DateRange) getRange();
656        double axisMin = this.timeline.toTimelineValue(range.getLowerMillis());
657        double axisMax = this.timeline.toTimelineValue(range.getUpperMillis());
658        double result = 0.0;
659        if (RectangleEdge.isTopOrBottom(edge)) {
660            double minX = area.getX();
661            double maxX = area.getMaxX();
662            if (isInverted()) {
663                result = maxX + ((value - axisMin) / (axisMax - axisMin))
664                         * (minX - maxX);
665            }
666            else {
667                result = minX + ((value - axisMin) / (axisMax - axisMin))
668                         * (maxX - minX);
669            }
670        }
671        else if (RectangleEdge.isLeftOrRight(edge)) {
672            double minY = area.getMinY();
673            double maxY = area.getMaxY();
674            if (isInverted()) {
675                result = minY + (((value - axisMin) / (axisMax - axisMin))
676                         * (maxY - minY));
677            }
678            else {
679                result = maxY - (((value - axisMin) / (axisMax - axisMin))
680                         * (maxY - minY));
681            }
682        }
683        return result;
684    }
685
686    /**
687     * Translates a date to Java2D coordinates, based on the range displayed by
688     * this axis for the specified data area.
689     *
690     * @param date  the date.
691     * @param area  the rectangle (in Java2D space) where the data is to be
692     *              plotted.
693     * @param edge  the axis location.
694     *
695     * @return The coordinate corresponding to the supplied date.
696     */
697    public double dateToJava2D(Date date, Rectangle2D area, 
698            RectangleEdge edge) {
699        double value = date.getTime();
700        return valueToJava2D(value, area, edge);
701    }
702
703    /**
704     * Translates a Java2D coordinate into the corresponding data value.  To
705     * perform this translation, you need to know the area used for plotting
706     * data, and which edge the axis is located on.
707     *
708     * @param java2DValue  the coordinate in Java2D space.
709     * @param area  the rectangle (in Java2D space) where the data is to be
710     *              plotted.
711     * @param edge  the axis location.
712     *
713     * @return A data value.
714     */
715    @Override
716    public double java2DToValue(double java2DValue, Rectangle2D area, 
717            RectangleEdge edge) {
718
719        DateRange range = (DateRange) getRange();
720        double axisMin = this.timeline.toTimelineValue(range.getLowerMillis());
721        double axisMax = this.timeline.toTimelineValue(range.getUpperMillis());
722
723        double min = 0.0;
724        double max = 0.0;
725        if (RectangleEdge.isTopOrBottom(edge)) {
726            min = area.getX();
727            max = area.getMaxX();
728        }
729        else if (RectangleEdge.isLeftOrRight(edge)) {
730            min = area.getMaxY();
731            max = area.getY();
732        }
733
734        double result;
735        if (isInverted()) {
736             result = axisMax - ((java2DValue - min) / (max - min)
737                      * (axisMax - axisMin));
738        }
739        else {
740             result = axisMin + ((java2DValue - min) / (max - min)
741                      * (axisMax - axisMin));
742        }
743
744        return this.timeline.toMillisecond((long) result);
745    }
746
747    /**
748     * Calculates the value of the lowest visible tick on the axis.
749     *
750     * @param unit  date unit to use.
751     *
752     * @return The value of the lowest visible tick on the axis.
753     */
754    public Date calculateLowestVisibleTickValue(DateTickUnit unit) {
755        return nextStandardDate(getMinimumDate(), unit);
756    }
757
758    /**
759     * Calculates the value of the highest visible tick on the axis.
760     *
761     * @param unit  date unit to use.
762     *
763     * @return The value of the highest visible tick on the axis.
764     */
765    public Date calculateHighestVisibleTickValue(DateTickUnit unit) {
766        return previousStandardDate(getMaximumDate(), unit);
767    }
768
769    /**
770     * Returns the previous "standard" date, for a given date and tick unit.
771     *
772     * @param date  the reference date.
773     * @param unit  the tick unit.
774     *
775     * @return The previous "standard" date.
776     */
777    protected Date previousStandardDate(Date date, DateTickUnit unit) {
778
779        int milliseconds;
780        int seconds;
781        int minutes;
782        int hours;
783        int days;
784        int months;
785        int years;
786
787        Calendar calendar = Calendar.getInstance(this.timeZone, this.locale);
788        calendar.setTime(date);
789        int count = unit.getMultiple();
790        int current = calendar.get(unit.getCalendarField());
791        int value = count * (current / count);
792
793        if (DateTickUnitType.MILLISECOND.equals(unit.getUnitType())) {
794            years = calendar.get(Calendar.YEAR);
795            months = calendar.get(Calendar.MONTH);
796            days = calendar.get(Calendar.DATE);
797            hours = calendar.get(Calendar.HOUR_OF_DAY);
798            minutes = calendar.get(Calendar.MINUTE);
799            seconds = calendar.get(Calendar.SECOND);
800            calendar.set(years, months, days, hours, minutes, seconds);
801            calendar.set(Calendar.MILLISECOND, value);
802            Date mm = calendar.getTime();
803            if (mm.getTime() >= date.getTime()) {
804                calendar.set(Calendar.MILLISECOND, value - count);
805                mm = calendar.getTime();
806            }
807            return mm;
808        }
809        else if (DateTickUnitType.SECOND.equals(unit.getUnitType())) {
810            years = calendar.get(Calendar.YEAR);
811            months = calendar.get(Calendar.MONTH);
812            days = calendar.get(Calendar.DATE);
813            hours = calendar.get(Calendar.HOUR_OF_DAY);
814            minutes = calendar.get(Calendar.MINUTE);
815            if (this.tickMarkPosition == DateTickMarkPosition.START) {
816                milliseconds = 0;
817            }
818            else if (this.tickMarkPosition == DateTickMarkPosition.MIDDLE) {
819                milliseconds = 500;
820            }
821            else {
822                milliseconds = 999;
823            }
824            calendar.set(Calendar.MILLISECOND, milliseconds);
825            calendar.set(years, months, days, hours, minutes, value);
826            Date dd = calendar.getTime();
827            if (dd.getTime() >= date.getTime()) {
828                calendar.set(Calendar.SECOND, value - count);
829                dd = calendar.getTime();
830            }
831            return dd;
832        }
833        else if (DateTickUnitType.MINUTE.equals(unit.getUnitType())) {
834            years = calendar.get(Calendar.YEAR);
835            months = calendar.get(Calendar.MONTH);
836            days = calendar.get(Calendar.DATE);
837            hours = calendar.get(Calendar.HOUR_OF_DAY);
838            if (this.tickMarkPosition == DateTickMarkPosition.START) {
839                seconds = 0;
840            }
841            else if (this.tickMarkPosition == DateTickMarkPosition.MIDDLE) {
842                seconds = 30;
843            }
844            else {
845                seconds = 59;
846            }
847            calendar.clear(Calendar.MILLISECOND);
848            calendar.set(years, months, days, hours, value, seconds);
849            Date d0 = calendar.getTime();
850            if (d0.getTime() >= date.getTime()) {
851                calendar.set(Calendar.MINUTE, value - count);
852                d0 = calendar.getTime();
853            }
854            return d0;
855        }
856        else if (DateTickUnitType.HOUR.equals(unit.getUnitType())) {
857            years = calendar.get(Calendar.YEAR);
858            months = calendar.get(Calendar.MONTH);
859            days = calendar.get(Calendar.DATE);
860            if (this.tickMarkPosition == DateTickMarkPosition.START) {
861                minutes = 0;
862                seconds = 0;
863            }
864            else if (this.tickMarkPosition == DateTickMarkPosition.MIDDLE) {
865                minutes = 30;
866                seconds = 0;
867            }
868            else {
869                minutes = 59;
870                seconds = 59;
871            }
872            calendar.clear(Calendar.MILLISECOND);
873            calendar.set(years, months, days, value, minutes, seconds);
874            Date d1 = calendar.getTime();
875            if (d1.getTime() >= date.getTime()) {
876                calendar.set(Calendar.HOUR_OF_DAY, value - count);
877                d1 = calendar.getTime();
878            }
879            return d1;
880        }
881        else if (DateTickUnitType.DAY.equals(unit.getUnitType())) {
882            years = calendar.get(Calendar.YEAR);
883            months = calendar.get(Calendar.MONTH);
884            if (this.tickMarkPosition == DateTickMarkPosition.START) {
885                hours = 0;
886            }
887            else if (this.tickMarkPosition == DateTickMarkPosition.MIDDLE) {
888                hours = 12;
889            }
890            else {
891                hours = 23;
892            }
893            calendar.clear(Calendar.MILLISECOND);
894            calendar.set(years, months, value, hours, 0, 0);
895            // long result = calendar.getTimeInMillis();
896                // won't work with JDK 1.3
897            Date d2 = calendar.getTime();
898            if (d2.getTime() >= date.getTime()) {
899                calendar.set(Calendar.DATE, value - count);
900                d2 = calendar.getTime();
901            }
902            return d2;
903        }
904        else if (DateTickUnitType.MONTH.equals(unit.getUnitType())) {
905            value = count * ((current + 1) / count) - 1;
906            years = calendar.get(Calendar.YEAR);
907            calendar.clear(Calendar.MILLISECOND);
908            calendar.set(years, value, 1, 0, 0, 0);
909            Month month = new Month(calendar.getTime(), this.timeZone,
910                    this.locale);
911            Date standardDate = month.calculateDateForPosition(
912                    this.tickMarkPosition);
913            long millis = standardDate.getTime();
914            if (millis >= date.getTime()) {
915                for (int i = 0; i < count; i++) {
916                    month = (Month) month.previous();
917                }
918                // need to peg the month in case the time zone isn't the
919                // default - see bug 2078057
920                month.peg(Calendar.getInstance(this.timeZone));
921                standardDate = month.calculateDateForPosition(
922                        this.tickMarkPosition);
923            }
924            return standardDate;
925        }
926        else if (DateTickUnitType.YEAR.equals(unit.getUnitType())) {
927            if (this.tickMarkPosition == DateTickMarkPosition.START) {
928                months = 0;
929                days = 1;
930            }
931            else if (this.tickMarkPosition == DateTickMarkPosition.MIDDLE) {
932                months = 6;
933                days = 1;
934            }
935            else {
936                months = 11;
937                days = 31;
938            }
939            calendar.clear(Calendar.MILLISECOND);
940            calendar.set(value, months, days, 0, 0, 0);
941            Date d3 = calendar.getTime();
942            if (d3.getTime() >= date.getTime()) {
943                calendar.set(Calendar.YEAR, value - count);
944                d3 = calendar.getTime();
945            }
946            return d3;
947        }
948        return null;
949    }
950
951    /**
952     * Returns the first "standard" date (based on the specified field and
953     * units).
954     *
955     * @param date  the reference date.
956     * @param unit  the date tick unit.
957     *
958     * @return The next "standard" date.
959     */
960    protected Date nextStandardDate(Date date, DateTickUnit unit) {
961        Date previous = previousStandardDate(date, unit);
962        Calendar calendar = Calendar.getInstance(this.timeZone, this.locale);
963        calendar.setTime(previous);
964        calendar.add(unit.getCalendarField(), unit.getMultiple());
965        return calendar.getTime();
966    }
967
968    /**
969     * Returns a collection of standard date tick units that uses the default
970     * time zone.  This collection will be used by default, but you are free
971     * to create your own collection if you want to (see the
972     * {@link ValueAxis#setStandardTickUnits(TickUnitSource)} method inherited
973     * from the {@link ValueAxis} class).
974     *
975     * @return A collection of standard date tick units.
976     */
977    public static TickUnitSource createStandardDateTickUnits() {
978        return createStandardDateTickUnits(TimeZone.getDefault(),
979                Locale.getDefault());
980    }
981
982    /**
983     * Returns a collection of standard date tick units.  This collection will
984     * be used by default, but you are free to create your own collection if
985     * you want to (see the
986     * {@link ValueAxis#setStandardTickUnits(TickUnitSource)} method inherited
987     * from the {@link ValueAxis} class).
988     *
989     * @param zone  the time zone ({@code null} not permitted).
990     * @param locale  the locale ({@code null} not permitted).
991     *
992     * @return A collection of standard date tick units.
993     */
994    public static TickUnitSource createStandardDateTickUnits(TimeZone zone,
995            Locale locale) {
996
997        Args.nullNotPermitted(zone, "zone");
998        Args.nullNotPermitted(locale, "locale");
999        TickUnits units = new TickUnits();
1000
1001        // date formatters
1002        DateFormat f1 = new SimpleDateFormat("HH:mm:ss.SSS", locale);
1003        DateFormat f2 = new SimpleDateFormat("HH:mm:ss", locale);
1004        DateFormat f3 = new SimpleDateFormat("HH:mm", locale);
1005        DateFormat f4 = new SimpleDateFormat("d-MMM, HH:mm", locale);
1006        DateFormat f5 = new SimpleDateFormat("d-MMM", locale);
1007        DateFormat f6 = new SimpleDateFormat("MMM-yyyy", locale);
1008        DateFormat f7 = new SimpleDateFormat("yyyy", locale);
1009
1010        f1.setTimeZone(zone);
1011        f2.setTimeZone(zone);
1012        f3.setTimeZone(zone);
1013        f4.setTimeZone(zone);
1014        f5.setTimeZone(zone);
1015        f6.setTimeZone(zone);
1016        f7.setTimeZone(zone);
1017
1018        // milliseconds
1019        units.add(new DateTickUnit(DateTickUnitType.MILLISECOND, 1, f1));
1020        units.add(new DateTickUnit(DateTickUnitType.MILLISECOND, 5,
1021                DateTickUnitType.MILLISECOND, 1, f1));
1022        units.add(new DateTickUnit(DateTickUnitType.MILLISECOND, 10,
1023                DateTickUnitType.MILLISECOND, 1, f1));
1024        units.add(new DateTickUnit(DateTickUnitType.MILLISECOND, 25,
1025                DateTickUnitType.MILLISECOND, 5, f1));
1026        units.add(new DateTickUnit(DateTickUnitType.MILLISECOND, 50,
1027                DateTickUnitType.MILLISECOND, 10, f1));
1028        units.add(new DateTickUnit(DateTickUnitType.MILLISECOND, 100,
1029                DateTickUnitType.MILLISECOND, 10, f1));
1030        units.add(new DateTickUnit(DateTickUnitType.MILLISECOND, 250,
1031                DateTickUnitType.MILLISECOND, 10, f1));
1032        units.add(new DateTickUnit(DateTickUnitType.MILLISECOND, 500,
1033                DateTickUnitType.MILLISECOND, 50, f1));
1034
1035        // seconds
1036        units.add(new DateTickUnit(DateTickUnitType.SECOND, 1,
1037                DateTickUnitType.MILLISECOND, 50, f2));
1038        units.add(new DateTickUnit(DateTickUnitType.SECOND, 5,
1039                DateTickUnitType.SECOND, 1, f2));
1040        units.add(new DateTickUnit(DateTickUnitType.SECOND, 10,
1041                DateTickUnitType.SECOND, 1, f2));
1042        units.add(new DateTickUnit(DateTickUnitType.SECOND, 30,
1043                DateTickUnitType.SECOND, 5, f2));
1044
1045        // minutes
1046        units.add(new DateTickUnit(DateTickUnitType.MINUTE, 1,
1047                DateTickUnitType.SECOND, 5, f3));
1048        units.add(new DateTickUnit(DateTickUnitType.MINUTE, 2,
1049                DateTickUnitType.SECOND, 10, f3));
1050        units.add(new DateTickUnit(DateTickUnitType.MINUTE, 5,
1051                DateTickUnitType.MINUTE, 1, f3));
1052        units.add(new DateTickUnit(DateTickUnitType.MINUTE, 10,
1053                DateTickUnitType.MINUTE, 1, f3));
1054        units.add(new DateTickUnit(DateTickUnitType.MINUTE, 15,
1055                DateTickUnitType.MINUTE, 5, f3));
1056        units.add(new DateTickUnit(DateTickUnitType.MINUTE, 20,
1057                DateTickUnitType.MINUTE, 5, f3));
1058        units.add(new DateTickUnit(DateTickUnitType.MINUTE, 30,
1059                DateTickUnitType.MINUTE, 5, f3));
1060
1061        // hours
1062        units.add(new DateTickUnit(DateTickUnitType.HOUR, 1,
1063                DateTickUnitType.MINUTE, 5, f3));
1064        units.add(new DateTickUnit(DateTickUnitType.HOUR, 2,
1065                DateTickUnitType.MINUTE, 10, f3));
1066        units.add(new DateTickUnit(DateTickUnitType.HOUR, 4,
1067                DateTickUnitType.MINUTE, 30, f3));
1068        units.add(new DateTickUnit(DateTickUnitType.HOUR, 6,
1069                DateTickUnitType.HOUR, 1, f3));
1070        units.add(new DateTickUnit(DateTickUnitType.HOUR, 12,
1071                DateTickUnitType.HOUR, 1, f4));
1072
1073        // days
1074        units.add(new DateTickUnit(DateTickUnitType.DAY, 1,
1075                DateTickUnitType.HOUR, 1, f5));
1076        units.add(new DateTickUnit(DateTickUnitType.DAY, 2,
1077                DateTickUnitType.HOUR, 1, f5));
1078        units.add(new DateTickUnit(DateTickUnitType.DAY, 7,
1079                DateTickUnitType.DAY, 1, f5));
1080        units.add(new DateTickUnit(DateTickUnitType.DAY, 15,
1081                DateTickUnitType.DAY, 1, f5));
1082
1083        // months
1084        units.add(new DateTickUnit(DateTickUnitType.MONTH, 1,
1085                DateTickUnitType.DAY, 1, f6));
1086        units.add(new DateTickUnit(DateTickUnitType.MONTH, 2,
1087                DateTickUnitType.DAY, 1, f6));
1088        units.add(new DateTickUnit(DateTickUnitType.MONTH, 3,
1089                DateTickUnitType.MONTH, 1, f6));
1090        units.add(new DateTickUnit(DateTickUnitType.MONTH, 4,
1091                DateTickUnitType.MONTH, 1, f6));
1092        units.add(new DateTickUnit(DateTickUnitType.MONTH, 6,
1093                DateTickUnitType.MONTH, 1, f6));
1094
1095        // years
1096        units.add(new DateTickUnit(DateTickUnitType.YEAR, 1,
1097                DateTickUnitType.MONTH, 1, f7));
1098        units.add(new DateTickUnit(DateTickUnitType.YEAR, 2,
1099                DateTickUnitType.MONTH, 3, f7));
1100        units.add(new DateTickUnit(DateTickUnitType.YEAR, 5,
1101                DateTickUnitType.YEAR, 1, f7));
1102        units.add(new DateTickUnit(DateTickUnitType.YEAR, 10,
1103                DateTickUnitType.YEAR, 1, f7));
1104        units.add(new DateTickUnit(DateTickUnitType.YEAR, 25,
1105                DateTickUnitType.YEAR, 5, f7));
1106        units.add(new DateTickUnit(DateTickUnitType.YEAR, 50,
1107                DateTickUnitType.YEAR, 10, f7));
1108        units.add(new DateTickUnit(DateTickUnitType.YEAR, 100,
1109                DateTickUnitType.YEAR, 20, f7));
1110
1111        return units;
1112
1113    }
1114
1115    /**
1116     * Rescales the axis to ensure that all data is visible.
1117     */
1118    @Override
1119    protected void autoAdjustRange() {
1120
1121        Plot plot = getPlot();
1122
1123        if (plot == null) {
1124            return;  // no plot, no data
1125        }
1126
1127        if (plot instanceof ValueAxisPlot) {
1128            ValueAxisPlot vap = (ValueAxisPlot) plot;
1129
1130            Range r = vap.getDataRange(this);
1131            if (r == null) {
1132                r = new DateRange();
1133            }
1134
1135            DateRange dr = dr(r);
1136                        setRange(dr, false, false);
1137        }
1138
1139    }
1140
1141        private DateRange dr(Range r) {
1142                long upper = this.timeline.toTimelineValue((long) r.getUpperBound());
1143                long lower;
1144                long fixedAutoRange = (long) getFixedAutoRange();
1145                if (fixedAutoRange > 0.0) {
1146                        lower = upper - fixedAutoRange;
1147                } else {
1148                        lower = this.timeline.toTimelineValue((long) r.getLowerBound());
1149                        double range = upper - lower;
1150                        long minRange = (long) getAutoRangeMinimumSize();
1151                        if (range < minRange) {
1152                                long expand = (long) (minRange - range) / 2;
1153                                upper = upper + expand;
1154                                lower = lower - expand;
1155                        }
1156                        upper = upper + (long) (range * getUpperMargin());
1157                        lower = lower - (long) (range * getLowerMargin());
1158                }
1159                upper = this.timeline.toMillisecond(upper);
1160                lower = this.timeline.toMillisecond(lower);
1161                DateRange dr = new DateRange(new Date(lower), new Date(upper));
1162                return dr;
1163        }
1164
1165    /**
1166     * Selects an appropriate tick value for the axis.  The strategy is to
1167     * display as many ticks as possible (selected from an array of 'standard'
1168     * tick units) without the labels overlapping.
1169     *
1170     * @param g2  the graphics device.
1171     * @param dataArea  the area defined by the axes.
1172     * @param edge  the axis location.
1173     */
1174    protected void selectAutoTickUnit(Graphics2D g2, Rectangle2D dataArea,
1175            RectangleEdge edge) {
1176
1177        if (RectangleEdge.isTopOrBottom(edge)) {
1178            selectHorizontalAutoTickUnit(g2, dataArea, edge);
1179        }
1180        else if (RectangleEdge.isLeftOrRight(edge)) {
1181            selectVerticalAutoTickUnit(g2, dataArea, edge);
1182        }
1183
1184    }
1185
1186    /**
1187     * Selects an appropriate tick size for the axis.  The strategy is to
1188     * display as many ticks as possible (selected from a collection of
1189     * 'standard' tick units) without the labels overlapping.
1190     *
1191     * @param g2  the graphics device.
1192     * @param dataArea  the area defined by the axes.
1193     * @param edge  the axis location.
1194     */
1195    protected void selectHorizontalAutoTickUnit(Graphics2D g2,
1196            Rectangle2D dataArea, RectangleEdge edge) {
1197
1198        double zero = valueToJava2D(0.0, dataArea, edge);
1199        double tickLabelWidth = estimateMaximumTickLabelWidth(g2,
1200                getTickUnit());
1201
1202        // start with the current tick unit...
1203        TickUnitSource tickUnits = getStandardTickUnits();
1204        TickUnit unit1 = tickUnits.getCeilingTickUnit(getTickUnit());
1205        double x1 = valueToJava2D(unit1.getSize(), dataArea, edge);
1206        double unit1Width = Math.abs(x1 - zero);
1207
1208        // then extrapolate...
1209        double guess = (tickLabelWidth / unit1Width) * unit1.getSize();
1210        DateTickUnit unit2 = (DateTickUnit) tickUnits.getCeilingTickUnit(guess);
1211        double x2 = valueToJava2D(unit2.getSize(), dataArea, edge);
1212        double unit2Width = Math.abs(x2 - zero);
1213        tickLabelWidth = estimateMaximumTickLabelWidth(g2, unit2);
1214        if (tickLabelWidth > unit2Width) {
1215            unit2 = (DateTickUnit) tickUnits.getLargerTickUnit(unit2);
1216        }
1217        setTickUnit(unit2, false, false);
1218    }
1219
1220    /**
1221     * Selects an appropriate tick size for the axis.  The strategy is to
1222     * display as many ticks as possible (selected from a collection of
1223     * 'standard' tick units) without the labels overlapping.
1224     *
1225     * @param g2  the graphics device.
1226     * @param dataArea  the area in which the plot should be drawn.
1227     * @param edge  the axis location.
1228     */
1229    protected void selectVerticalAutoTickUnit(Graphics2D g2,
1230            Rectangle2D dataArea, RectangleEdge edge) {
1231
1232        // start with the current tick unit...
1233        TickUnitSource tickUnits = getStandardTickUnits();
1234        double zero = valueToJava2D(0.0, dataArea, edge);
1235
1236        // start with a unit that is at least 1/10th of the axis length
1237        double estimate1 = getRange().getLength() / 10.0;
1238        DateTickUnit candidate1
1239            = (DateTickUnit) tickUnits.getCeilingTickUnit(estimate1);
1240        double labelHeight1 = estimateMaximumTickLabelHeight(g2, candidate1);
1241        double y1 = valueToJava2D(candidate1.getSize(), dataArea, edge);
1242        double candidate1UnitHeight = Math.abs(y1 - zero);
1243
1244        // now extrapolate based on label height and unit height...
1245        double estimate2
1246            = (labelHeight1 / candidate1UnitHeight) * candidate1.getSize();
1247        DateTickUnit candidate2
1248            = (DateTickUnit) tickUnits.getCeilingTickUnit(estimate2);
1249        double labelHeight2 = estimateMaximumTickLabelHeight(g2, candidate2);
1250        double y2 = valueToJava2D(candidate2.getSize(), dataArea, edge);
1251        double unit2Height = Math.abs(y2 - zero);
1252
1253       // make final selection...
1254       DateTickUnit finalUnit;
1255       if (labelHeight2 < unit2Height) {
1256           finalUnit = candidate2;
1257       }
1258       else {
1259           finalUnit = (DateTickUnit) tickUnits.getLargerTickUnit(candidate2);
1260       }
1261       setTickUnit(finalUnit, false, false);
1262
1263    }
1264
1265    /**
1266     * Estimates the maximum width of the tick labels, assuming the specified
1267     * tick unit is used.
1268     * <P>
1269     * Rather than computing the string bounds of every tick on the axis, we
1270     * just look at two values: the lower bound and the upper bound for the
1271     * axis.  These two values will usually be representative.
1272     *
1273     * @param g2  the graphics device.
1274     * @param unit  the tick unit to use for calculation.
1275     *
1276     * @return The estimated maximum width of the tick labels.
1277     */
1278    private double estimateMaximumTickLabelWidth(Graphics2D g2, 
1279            DateTickUnit unit) {
1280
1281        RectangleInsets tickLabelInsets = getTickLabelInsets();
1282        double result = tickLabelInsets.getLeft() + tickLabelInsets.getRight();
1283
1284        Font tickLabelFont = getTickLabelFont();
1285        FontRenderContext frc = g2.getFontRenderContext();
1286        LineMetrics lm = tickLabelFont.getLineMetrics("ABCxyz", frc);
1287        if (isVerticalTickLabels()) {
1288            // all tick labels have the same width (equal to the height of
1289            // the font)...
1290            result += lm.getHeight();
1291        }
1292        else {
1293            // look at lower and upper bounds...
1294            DateRange range = (DateRange) getRange();
1295            Date lower = range.getLowerDate();
1296            Date upper = range.getUpperDate();
1297            String lowerStr, upperStr;
1298            DateFormat formatter = getDateFormatOverride();
1299            if (formatter != null) {
1300                lowerStr = formatter.format(lower);
1301                upperStr = formatter.format(upper);
1302            }
1303            else {
1304                lowerStr = unit.dateToString(lower);
1305                upperStr = unit.dateToString(upper);
1306            }
1307            FontMetrics fm = g2.getFontMetrics(tickLabelFont);
1308            double w1 = fm.stringWidth(lowerStr);
1309            double w2 = fm.stringWidth(upperStr);
1310            result += Math.max(w1, w2);
1311        }
1312
1313        return result;
1314
1315    }
1316
1317    /**
1318     * Estimates the maximum width of the tick labels, assuming the specified
1319     * tick unit is used.
1320     * <P>
1321     * Rather than computing the string bounds of every tick on the axis, we
1322     * just look at two values: the lower bound and the upper bound for the
1323     * axis.  These two values will usually be representative.
1324     *
1325     * @param g2  the graphics device.
1326     * @param unit  the tick unit to use for calculation.
1327     *
1328     * @return The estimated maximum width of the tick labels.
1329     */
1330    private double estimateMaximumTickLabelHeight(Graphics2D g2,
1331            DateTickUnit unit) {
1332
1333        RectangleInsets tickLabelInsets = getTickLabelInsets();
1334        double result = tickLabelInsets.getTop() + tickLabelInsets.getBottom();
1335
1336        Font tickLabelFont = getTickLabelFont();
1337        FontRenderContext frc = g2.getFontRenderContext();
1338        LineMetrics lm = tickLabelFont.getLineMetrics("ABCxyz", frc);
1339        if (!isVerticalTickLabels()) {
1340            // all tick labels have the same width (equal to the height of
1341            // the font)...
1342            result += lm.getHeight();
1343        }
1344        else {
1345            // look at lower and upper bounds...
1346            DateRange range = (DateRange) getRange();
1347            Date lower = range.getLowerDate();
1348            Date upper = range.getUpperDate();
1349            String lowerStr, upperStr;
1350            DateFormat formatter = getDateFormatOverride();
1351            if (formatter != null) {
1352                lowerStr = formatter.format(lower);
1353                upperStr = formatter.format(upper);
1354            }
1355            else {
1356                lowerStr = unit.dateToString(lower);
1357                upperStr = unit.dateToString(upper);
1358            }
1359            FontMetrics fm = g2.getFontMetrics(tickLabelFont);
1360            double w1 = fm.stringWidth(lowerStr);
1361            double w2 = fm.stringWidth(upperStr);
1362            result += Math.max(w1, w2);
1363        }
1364
1365        return result;
1366
1367    }
1368
1369    /**
1370     * Calculates the positions of the tick labels for the axis, storing the
1371     * results in the tick label list (ready for drawing).
1372     *
1373     * @param g2  the graphics device.
1374     * @param state  the axis state.
1375     * @param dataArea  the area in which the plot should be drawn.
1376     * @param edge  the location of the axis.
1377     *
1378     * @return A list of ticks.
1379     */
1380    @Override
1381    public List<? extends Tick> refreshTicks(Graphics2D g2, AxisState state, 
1382            Rectangle2D dataArea, RectangleEdge edge) {
1383
1384        List<? extends Tick> result = null;
1385        if (RectangleEdge.isTopOrBottom(edge)) {
1386            result = refreshTicksHorizontal(g2, dataArea, edge);
1387        }
1388        else if (RectangleEdge.isLeftOrRight(edge)) {
1389            result = refreshTicksVertical(g2, dataArea, edge);
1390        }
1391        return result;
1392
1393    }
1394
1395    /**
1396     * Corrects the given tick date for the position setting.
1397     *
1398     * @param time  the tick date/time.
1399     * @param unit  the tick unit.
1400     * @param position  the tick position.
1401     *
1402     * @return The adjusted time.
1403     */
1404    private Date correctTickDateForPosition(Date time, DateTickUnit unit,
1405            DateTickMarkPosition position) {
1406        Date result = time;
1407        if (unit.getUnitType().equals(DateTickUnitType.MONTH)) {
1408            result = new Month(time, this.timeZone, this.locale).calculateDateForPosition(position);
1409        } else if (unit.getUnitType().equals(DateTickUnitType.YEAR)) {
1410            result = new Year(time, this.timeZone, this.locale).calculateDateForPosition(position);
1411        }
1412        return result;
1413    }
1414
1415    /**
1416     * Recalculates the ticks for the date axis.
1417     *
1418     * @param g2  the graphics device.
1419     * @param dataArea  the area in which the data is to be drawn.
1420     * @param edge  the location of the axis.
1421     *
1422     * @return A list of ticks.
1423     */
1424    protected List<? extends Tick> refreshTicksHorizontal(Graphics2D g2,
1425                Rectangle2D dataArea, RectangleEdge edge) {
1426
1427        List<DateTick> result = new ArrayList<>();
1428
1429        Font tickLabelFont = getTickLabelFont();
1430        g2.setFont(tickLabelFont);
1431
1432        if (isAutoTickUnitSelection()) {
1433            selectAutoTickUnit(g2, dataArea, edge);
1434        }
1435
1436        DateTickUnit unit = getTickUnit();
1437        Date tickDate = calculateLowestVisibleTickValue(unit);
1438        Date upperDate = getMaximumDate();
1439
1440        boolean hasRolled = false;
1441        while (tickDate.before(upperDate)) {
1442            // could add a flag to make the following correction optional...
1443            if (!hasRolled) {
1444                tickDate = correctTickDateForPosition(tickDate, unit,
1445                     this.tickMarkPosition);
1446            }
1447
1448            long lowestTickTime = tickDate.getTime();
1449            long distance = unit.addToDate(tickDate, this.timeZone).getTime()
1450                    - lowestTickTime;
1451            int minorTickSpaces = getMinorTickCount();
1452            if (minorTickSpaces <= 0) {
1453                minorTickSpaces = unit.getMinorTickCount();
1454            }
1455            for (int minorTick = 1; minorTick < minorTickSpaces; minorTick++) {
1456                long minorTickTime = lowestTickTime - distance
1457                        * minorTick / minorTickSpaces;
1458                if (minorTickTime > 0 && getRange().contains(minorTickTime)
1459                        && (!isHiddenValue(minorTickTime))) {
1460                    result.add(new DateTick(TickType.MINOR,
1461                            new Date(minorTickTime), "", TextAnchor.TOP_CENTER,
1462                            TextAnchor.CENTER, 0.0));
1463                }
1464            }
1465
1466            if (!isHiddenValue(tickDate.getTime())) {
1467                // work out the value, label and position
1468                String tickLabel;
1469                DateFormat formatter = getDateFormatOverride();
1470                if (formatter != null) {
1471                    tickLabel = formatter.format(tickDate);
1472                }
1473                else {
1474                    tickLabel = this.tickUnit.dateToString(tickDate);
1475                }
1476                TextAnchor anchor, rotationAnchor;
1477                double angle = 0.0;
1478                if (isVerticalTickLabels()) {
1479                    anchor = TextAnchor.CENTER_RIGHT;
1480                    rotationAnchor = TextAnchor.CENTER_RIGHT;
1481                    if (edge == RectangleEdge.TOP) {
1482                        angle = Math.PI / 2.0;
1483                    }
1484                    else {
1485                        angle = -Math.PI / 2.0;
1486                    }
1487                }
1488                else {
1489                    if (edge == RectangleEdge.TOP) {
1490                        anchor = TextAnchor.BOTTOM_CENTER;
1491                        rotationAnchor = TextAnchor.BOTTOM_CENTER;
1492                    }
1493                    else {
1494                        anchor = TextAnchor.TOP_CENTER;
1495                        rotationAnchor = TextAnchor.TOP_CENTER;
1496                    }
1497                }
1498
1499                DateTick tick = new DateTick(tickDate, tickLabel, anchor,
1500                        rotationAnchor, angle);
1501                result.add(tick);
1502                hasRolled = false;
1503
1504                long currentTickTime = tickDate.getTime();
1505                tickDate = unit.addToDate(tickDate, this.timeZone);
1506                long nextTickTime = tickDate.getTime();
1507                for (int minorTick = 1; minorTick < minorTickSpaces;
1508                        minorTick++) {
1509                    long minorTickTime = currentTickTime
1510                            + (nextTickTime - currentTickTime)
1511                            * minorTick / minorTickSpaces;
1512                    if (getRange().contains(minorTickTime)
1513                            && (!isHiddenValue(minorTickTime))) {
1514                        result.add(new DateTick(TickType.MINOR,
1515                                new Date(minorTickTime), "",
1516                                TextAnchor.TOP_CENTER, TextAnchor.CENTER,
1517                                0.0));
1518                    }
1519                }
1520
1521            }
1522            else {
1523                tickDate = unit.rollDate(tickDate, this.timeZone);
1524                hasRolled = true;
1525            }
1526        }
1527        return result;
1528
1529    }
1530
1531    /**
1532     * Recalculates the ticks for the date axis.
1533     *
1534     * @param g2  the graphics device.
1535     * @param dataArea  the area in which the plot should be drawn.
1536     * @param edge  the location of the axis.
1537     *
1538     * @return A list of ticks.
1539     */
1540    protected List<? extends Tick> refreshTicksVertical(Graphics2D g2,
1541            Rectangle2D dataArea, RectangleEdge edge) {
1542
1543        List<DateTick> result = new ArrayList<>();
1544
1545        Font tickLabelFont = getTickLabelFont();
1546        g2.setFont(tickLabelFont);
1547
1548        if (isAutoTickUnitSelection()) {
1549            selectAutoTickUnit(g2, dataArea, edge);
1550        }
1551        DateTickUnit unit = getTickUnit();
1552        Date tickDate = calculateLowestVisibleTickValue(unit);
1553        Date upperDate = getMaximumDate();
1554
1555        boolean hasRolled = false;
1556        while (tickDate.before(upperDate)) {
1557
1558            // could add a flag to make the following correction optional...
1559            if (!hasRolled) {
1560                tickDate = correctTickDateForPosition(tickDate, unit,
1561                    this.tickMarkPosition);
1562            }
1563
1564            long lowestTickTime = tickDate.getTime();
1565            long distance = unit.addToDate(tickDate, this.timeZone).getTime()
1566                    - lowestTickTime;
1567            int minorTickSpaces = getMinorTickCount();
1568            if (minorTickSpaces <= 0) {
1569                minorTickSpaces = unit.getMinorTickCount();
1570            }
1571            for (int minorTick = 1; minorTick < minorTickSpaces; minorTick++) {
1572                long minorTickTime = lowestTickTime - distance
1573                        * minorTick / minorTickSpaces;
1574                if (minorTickTime > 0 && getRange().contains(minorTickTime)
1575                        && (!isHiddenValue(minorTickTime))) {
1576                    result.add(new DateTick(TickType.MINOR,
1577                            new Date(minorTickTime), "", TextAnchor.TOP_CENTER,
1578                            TextAnchor.CENTER, 0.0));
1579                }
1580            }
1581            if (!isHiddenValue(tickDate.getTime())) {
1582                // work out the value, label and position
1583                String tickLabel;
1584                DateFormat formatter = getDateFormatOverride();
1585                if (formatter != null) {
1586                    tickLabel = formatter.format(tickDate);
1587                }
1588                else {
1589                    tickLabel = this.tickUnit.dateToString(tickDate);
1590                }
1591                TextAnchor anchor, rotationAnchor;
1592                double angle = 0.0;
1593                if (isVerticalTickLabels()) {
1594                    anchor = TextAnchor.BOTTOM_CENTER;
1595                    rotationAnchor = TextAnchor.BOTTOM_CENTER;
1596                    if (edge == RectangleEdge.LEFT) {
1597                        angle = -Math.PI / 2.0;
1598                    }
1599                    else {
1600                        angle = Math.PI / 2.0;
1601                    }
1602                }
1603                else {
1604                    if (edge == RectangleEdge.LEFT) {
1605                        anchor = TextAnchor.CENTER_RIGHT;
1606                        rotationAnchor = TextAnchor.CENTER_RIGHT;
1607                    }
1608                    else {
1609                        anchor = TextAnchor.CENTER_LEFT;
1610                        rotationAnchor = TextAnchor.CENTER_LEFT;
1611                    }
1612                }
1613
1614                DateTick tick = new DateTick(tickDate, tickLabel, anchor,
1615                        rotationAnchor, angle);
1616                result.add(tick);
1617                hasRolled = false;
1618
1619                long currentTickTime = tickDate.getTime();
1620                tickDate = unit.addToDate(tickDate, this.timeZone);
1621                long nextTickTime = tickDate.getTime();
1622                for (int minorTick = 1; minorTick < minorTickSpaces;
1623                        minorTick++) {
1624                    long minorTickTime = currentTickTime
1625                            + (nextTickTime - currentTickTime)
1626                            * minorTick / minorTickSpaces;
1627                    if (getRange().contains(minorTickTime)
1628                            && (!isHiddenValue(minorTickTime))) {
1629                        result.add(new DateTick(TickType.MINOR,
1630                                new Date(minorTickTime), "",
1631                                TextAnchor.TOP_CENTER, TextAnchor.CENTER,
1632                                0.0));
1633                    }
1634                }
1635            }
1636            else {
1637                tickDate = unit.rollDate(tickDate, this.timeZone);
1638                hasRolled = true;
1639            }
1640        }
1641        return result;
1642    }
1643
1644    /**
1645     * Draws the axis on a Java 2D graphics device (such as the screen or a
1646     * printer).
1647     *
1648     * @param g2  the graphics device ({@code null} not permitted).
1649     * @param cursor  the cursor location.
1650     * @param plotArea  the area within which the axes and data should be
1651     *                  drawn ({@code null} not permitted).
1652     * @param dataArea  the area within which the data should be drawn
1653     *                  ({@code null} not permitted).
1654     * @param edge  the location of the axis ({@code null} not permitted).
1655     * @param plotState  collects information about the plot
1656     *                   ({@code null} permitted).
1657     *
1658     * @return The axis state (never {@code null}).
1659     */
1660    @Override
1661    public AxisState draw(Graphics2D g2, double cursor, Rectangle2D plotArea,
1662            Rectangle2D dataArea, RectangleEdge edge,
1663            PlotRenderingInfo plotState) {
1664
1665        // if the axis is not visible, don't draw it...
1666        if (!isVisible()) {
1667            AxisState state = new AxisState(cursor);
1668            // even though the axis is not visible, we need to refresh ticks in
1669            // case the grid is being drawn...
1670            List ticks = refreshTicks(g2, state, dataArea, edge);
1671            state.setTicks(ticks);
1672            return state;
1673        }
1674
1675        // draw the tick marks and labels...
1676        AxisState state = drawTickMarksAndLabels(g2, cursor, plotArea,
1677                dataArea, edge);
1678
1679        // draw the axis label (note that 'state' is passed in *and*
1680        // returned)...
1681        if (getAttributedLabel() != null) {
1682            state = drawAttributedLabel(getAttributedLabel(), g2, plotArea, 
1683                    dataArea, edge, state);
1684            
1685        } else {
1686            state = drawLabel(getLabel(), g2, plotArea, dataArea, edge, state);
1687        }
1688        createAndAddEntity(cursor, state, dataArea, edge, plotState);
1689        return state;
1690
1691    }
1692
1693    /**
1694     * Zooms in on the current range (zoom-in stops once the axis length 
1695     * reaches the equivalent of one millisecond).  
1696     *
1697     * @param lowerPercent  the new lower bound.
1698     * @param upperPercent  the new upper bound.
1699     */
1700    @Override
1701    public void zoomRange(double lowerPercent, double upperPercent) {
1702        double start = this.timeline.toTimelineValue(
1703                (long) getRange().getLowerBound());
1704        double end = this.timeline.toTimelineValue(
1705                (long) getRange().getUpperBound());
1706        double length = end - start;
1707        Range adjusted;
1708        long adjStart, adjEnd;
1709        if (isInverted()) {
1710            adjStart = (long) (start + (length * (1 - upperPercent)));
1711            adjEnd = (long) (start + (length * (1 - lowerPercent)));
1712        }
1713        else {
1714            adjStart = (long) (start + length * lowerPercent);
1715            adjEnd = (long) (start + length * upperPercent);
1716        }
1717        // when zooming to sub-millisecond ranges, it can be the case that
1718        // adjEnd == adjStart...and we can't have an axis with zero length
1719        // so we apply this instead:
1720        if (adjEnd <= adjStart) {
1721            adjEnd = adjStart + 1L;
1722        } 
1723        adjusted = new DateRange(this.timeline.toMillisecond(adjStart),
1724               this.timeline.toMillisecond(adjEnd));
1725        setRange(adjusted);
1726    }
1727
1728    /**
1729     * Tests this axis for equality with an arbitrary object.
1730     *
1731     * @param obj  the object ({@code null} permitted).
1732     *
1733     * @return A boolean.
1734     */
1735    @Override
1736    public boolean equals(Object obj) {
1737        if (obj == this) {
1738            return true;
1739        }
1740        if (!(obj instanceof DateAxis)) {
1741            return false;
1742        }
1743        DateAxis that = (DateAxis) obj;
1744        if (!Objects.equals(this.timeZone, that.timeZone)) {
1745            return false;
1746        }
1747        if (!Objects.equals(this.locale, that.locale)) {
1748            return false;
1749        }
1750        if (!Objects.equals(this.tickUnit, that.tickUnit)) {
1751            return false;
1752        }
1753        if (!Objects.equals(this.dateFormatOverride, that.dateFormatOverride)) {
1754            return false;
1755        }
1756        if (!Objects.equals(this.tickMarkPosition, that.tickMarkPosition)) {
1757            return false;
1758        }
1759        if (!Objects.equals(this.timeline, that.timeline)) {
1760            return false;
1761        }
1762        return super.equals(obj);
1763    }
1764
1765    /**
1766     * Returns a hash code for this object.
1767     *
1768     * @return A hash code.
1769     */
1770    @Override
1771    public int hashCode() {
1772        return super.hashCode();
1773    }
1774
1775    /**
1776     * Returns a clone of the object.
1777     *
1778     * @return A clone.
1779     *
1780     * @throws CloneNotSupportedException if some component of the axis does
1781     *         not support cloning.
1782     */
1783    @Override
1784    public Object clone() throws CloneNotSupportedException {
1785        DateAxis clone = (DateAxis) super.clone();
1786        // 'dateTickUnit' is immutable : no need to clone
1787        if (this.dateFormatOverride != null) {
1788            clone.dateFormatOverride
1789                = (DateFormat) this.dateFormatOverride.clone();
1790        }
1791        // 'tickMarkPosition' is immutable : no need to clone
1792        return clone;
1793    }

1795}
